newsitem.title: USA: Putnam's head of domestic equities resigns.
newsitem.headline: Putnam's head of domestic equities resigns.

text.p: Putnam Investments said Friday that Peter Carman, head of the domestic equity group, has resigned to join Citicorp to head global asset management.

As a result, Putnam has consolidated its international and domestic groups, which include retail and institutional mutual funds. Senior managing director Tim Ferguson, head of the international group, will now also head the domestic group, Putnam said.

"This change in equity leadership gives Putnam the opportunity to accelerate the integration of domestic and international equity investing," Putnam chief executive Lawrence Lasser said in a press release. "It will better leverage the talents of these now separate groups."
Ferguson came to Putnam in 1996 from HSBC Asset Management in London.
